attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2udUC5QACWVmlU7K7_description
attribs.current: Airborne creatures take a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls against an air elemental.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2wdzt03GgZYqsZ5KN_description
attribs.current:
The air elemental can transform into a whirlwind as a standard action. It can remain in whirlwind form for 5 of rounds. The air elemental in whirlwind form can move freely into and through other creatures’ spaces, and it does not provoke attacks of opportunity as a result of its movement.

The base of an air elemental in whirlwind form occupies a 5-foot square. The whirlwind is twice as wide at its top as its base and has a height equal to four times the width of its base; this doesn’t change the size category of the air elemental. It can vary the size of its whirlwind form up to a maximum of a base equal to its normal space as a swift or move action. An air elemental in whirlwind form does not threaten any spaces around it, and it cannot make its normal attacks.

If an air elemental in whirlwind form enters the space of another creature, that creature must succeed at a Fortitude save DC of 18 or take the whirlwind’s listed damage. If the whirlwind covers all of the creature’s space, the creature must also succeed at a Reflex save or be picked up by the whirlwind and carried along with it. A carried creature is flat-footed, grappled, and off-target, and it automatically takes the whirlwind'fs damage at the beginning of its turn. If the carried creature can fly, it can attempt a Reflex save as a move action, escaping on a successful save. If a carried creature does not escape, it can attempt a Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it can take any remaining actions it has on its turn (other than movement). On a failed save, the carried creature is unable to act until its next turn or until the whirlwind releases it.

An air elemental in whirlwind form can carry up to two creatures of its size, with the total number it can carry doubling for every size category the affected creatures are smaller than the whirlwind. The air elemental in whirlwind form can eject a carried creature at any time during its turn, dropping the carried creature in a space of its choice adjacent to its position at the time of ejection. At the GMfs discretion, if the whirlwind is in contact with dirt, gases, water, or other material that can be easily drawn into it, the whirlwind blocks all vision within it (including darkvision) and blocks line of sight through it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2wdzt03GgZYqsZ5KN_effect
attribs.current: Creature takes full damage and is carried.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The elementals prioritize airborne targets. They use their whirlwind ability to trap and disorient the PCs.

Morale The elementals are as relentless as the storm around them and fight until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zNfudsli-29Bz5fp_description
attribs.current: A living hologram can hold perfectly still so that it appears to be a normal hologram. It can take 20 on Stealth checks to hide in plain sight as a hologram (usually among other holograms).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zUo1LkuJuF7xJIJZ_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a living hologram can temporarily cause its fist (or a melee weapon, if it has been programmed to have one) to become substantial. This functions as a natural weapon that deals bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the attack creates a bright flash of light, and the target must succeed at a DC 18 Reflex save or be dazzled for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zZEWcEy2PCaKzgna_description
attribs.current: In most cases, it is difficult to completely destroy a living hologram in combat. A living hologram reduced to 0 Hit Points vanishes, though its corrupted projector reconstructs it in [[1d4]] (1d4) hours. The only way to permanently destroy a living hologram is to find its projector and either repair or destroy it. Living holograms are aware that their existences are tied to their projectors and protect the machinery at all costs.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2zk7FQk9bdRFxor2t_description
attribs.current: A living hologram can’t travel more than 100 feet from its projector. If it is ever forced to do so, it is immediately destroyed, though only temporarily (see rejuvenation above).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ2ygnRhGzMYFqRODYJ_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a living hologram can temporarily cause its fist (or a melee weapon, if it has been programmed to have one) to become substantial. This functions as a natural weapon that deals bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the attack creates a bright flash of light, and the target must succeed at a DC 18 Reflex save or be dazzled for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2yqJtdeH7uZcXJgaH_effect
attribs.current: Target is fooled by the image.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ2yqJtdeH7uZcXJgaH_description
attribs.current:
The living hologram weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form it can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures.

The image it produces is a purely visual hologram at long range 720 ft.. The image has no sound, smell, texture, or temperature. The image can’t extend beyond four 90-foot cubes. The image lasts for as long as the living hologram concentrates. It can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The holograms cast holographic images to distract the PCs, then manoeuvre through the battlefield using flyby attacks.

Morale The holograms fight to protect the facility until they reach the end of their tethers or their projector (located in area A3) is destroyed or shut down.

attribs.name: weaknesses
attribs.current: Vulnerable to Critical Hits, Vulnerable to Electricity

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The loggerbots charge at the PCs and attack with their integrated axes, using forester’s frenzy whenever possible.

Morale Unless the PCs reboot the robots by accessing the console in area A3, the loggerbots follow their new programming to defend the sivv facility until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ30RjQHdsP2H0uKlyL_description
attribs.current: When a loggerbot makes a full attack, it can make up to three attacks instead of two. Each of these attacks takes a –6 penalty instead of a –4 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ31-5YORBXbfEkk4EI_target
attribs.current: Self or Construct with the Technological Subtype

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ31-5YORBXbfEkk4EI_description
attribs.current: A loggerbot’s nanites heal it, restoring a number of Hit Points per hour equal to its CR. Once per day as a full action, the robot can restore [[6d8]] (6d8) Hit Points to itself or any touched construct with the technological subtype.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ30KFiE2gWWk0gHhxs_description
attribs.current: A balanced, wedge-shaped blade affixed to a lightweight haft, a handaxe can be wielded in melee or thrown. The flexibility of handaxes makes them a favourite of explorers of all types. The sintered handaxe uses a denser ceramic material for added heft and a much keener edge. Most handaxes have blade covers to prevent accidental injury to the wielder.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The prexian mutantspawns begin combat by casting confusion and then fly toward the ceiling. They alternate between casting mind thrust to force their horrific knowledge of sivv experimentation into the PCs’ minds and diving to attack with their irradiated bites.

Morale Unable to safely use their teleport spell-like ability to flee, the prexian mutantspawns fight until destroyed.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Prexian Mutant Spawn|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Prexian Mutant Spawn|engines_status}@{Prexian Mutant Spawn|power_core_status}@{Prexian Mutant Spawn|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33ukK7Z7SL9uA46Kv_target
attribs.current: Self plus 5 bulk of objects only

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Numbing Taclas with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ34ERDT1f3GrhjCw3C_description
attribs.current: A creature bitten by a prexian mutantspawn or wounded by a melee weapon a mutantspawn carries must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be exposed to a sudden pulse of supernatural radiation. This functions as medium radiation that affects only the mutantspawn’s target.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ338BJlJxlG7iniZkB_special
attribs.current: Disarm, Powered (Capacity 20; Usage 2), Reach, Stun, Trip

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ338BJlJxlG7iniZkB_description
attribs.current: A tactical lash, or taclash as it is commonly called, is a length of nylon cord reinforced with carbon fibres. Taclashes were originally used by military organizations as a form of crowd control, and explorers and mercenaries came to appreciate the utility of the weapon. When a numbing taclash connects, a low electrical shock transmits through the lash. The shock is too mild to deal damage, but it can stun the target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33ZHhuULY7mLXZy7A_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creature’s turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33dAKl0ZjVExftZNh_description
attribs.current: This spell floods the area of effect with dangerous radiation. The strength of the radiation you create depends on your caster level, as detailed below. The central irradiated area is always a 10-foot-radius spread that expands normally per the rules for radiation areas of effect (see page 403). Creatures within the area are exposed to the radiation only once; the radiation does not linger in the area. The saving throw to resist the radiation effects is set by the spell rather than the standard save DC for radiation.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33i2luziyyEQ3ADsc_description
attribs.current:
The prexian mutant spawn creates an enervating ray of magic. It must make a ranged attack against its opponent’s EAC. On a hit, the target is immediately exhausted for the spell’s duration. A creature that succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw is only fatigued, unless it is already fatigued, in which case it instead becomes exhausted despite the saving throw.

This spell has no effect on a creature that is already exhausted. Unlike normal exhaustion or fatigue, the effect ends as soon as the spell’s duration expires.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33i2luziyyEQ3ADsc_save_effect
attribs.current: Target is fatigued for 11 minutes unless already fatigued then it is exhausted instead.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33mSWkoh8347xCqOW_effect
attribs.current: Target suffers -2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill check for 11 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33mSWkoh8347xCqOW_save_effect
attribs.current: Target suffers -2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill check for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33mSWkoh8347xCqOW_description
attribs.current: The prexian mutant spawn telepathically racks the target’s mind and body with agonizing pain that imposes a –2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks. A target that succeeds at a Will saving throw reduces the duration to 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33pc88xIUPE3yZh3G_description
attribs.current: The prexian mutant spawn divines the most vulnerable portion of its opponent’s mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ33ukK7Z7SL9uA46Kv_description
attribs.current: This spell instantly transports the prexian mutant spawn to a designated destination within 2,000 miles. Interplanar and interplanetary travel is not possible, and neither is travel between two moving starships during combat, though you might be able to teleport to a planet’s surface from an orbiting starship. It can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed 5 bulks. As the caster, it needs not attempt a saving throw, nor is spell resistance applicable to it. Only objects held receive saving throws and benefit from spell resistance.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: All-Around Vision, Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The nanotech golem fires a nanite scattershot and closes into melee range to attack with its nanite filament, harassing PCs with its nanite cloud.

Morale The nanotech golem is programmed to eradicate any threats to the facility and fights until destroyed or until all targets are unconscious.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3BJzsMYxFefXZZnX3_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem sees in all directions at once.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3BO4Kag2Kqf0RmXua_description
attribs.current:
A cybernetic or nanotech golem is immune to any spell or spell-like ability that allows spell resistance, unless the spell specifically lists constructs in its Targets entry. In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against the golem as follows.
The golem can be affected by discharge or greater discharge but has a unique reaction to the spells. If the golem fails a saving throw against either spell, it becomes confused for 1d4 rounds instead of suffering the spell’s normal effect. The golem can attempt a Fortitude save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.
Magical effects that deal cold damage slow (as the slow spell) the golem for 3 rounds (no save). If the golem has a haste circuit and it is active, this effect counters the haste circuit but has no other effect.
The golem automatically fails saving throws against weapons and magical effects that deal electricity damage. However, such an effect merely breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals it for 1 Hit Point per 3 damage the effect would have dealt. Any damage that exceeds the golem’s maximum Hit Points is stored as charges for its weapons, at a rate of 1 charge per Hit Point the golem would have gained. Any additional damage is ignored.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3ADgq4RvhMZMxj-fI_description
attribs.current: Nanites swarm within 5 feet of the nanotech golem, and the golem can enter an opponent’s space, provoking an attack of opportunity from that foe. At the end of each of the golem’s turns, each creature within 5 feet of the golem or sharing its space takes 8d6 piercing damage and is nauseated for 1 round. A successful DC 20 Fortitude saving throw halves the damage and negates the condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3ADgq4RvhMZMxj-fI_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Nauseated for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3BMixVx4Z2IwMcLKg_description
attribs.current: A golem can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3BQnausXX6VTf5krX_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a nanotech golem can unleash a stream of nanite particles at a single target as a kinetic attack with a range increment of 90 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ3A2Zz-IC5jBlQ7Zg2_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a nanotech golem can unleash a stream of nanite particles at a single target as a kinetic attack with a range increment of 90 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3BTviISbVy3Pu2o7d_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem is immune to critical hits, as well as entangled, flat-footed, off-kilter, off-target, pinned, prone, and staggered effects. It takes only half damage from any attack or effect that targets only one creature. Automatic fire must hit the golem as if it were three targets to deal full damage to it. In addition, the golem can move through openings 1 inch wide without squeezing, and it can squeeze to move through microscopic openings.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Animated Commander's Harness|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Animated Commander's Harness|engines_status}@{Animated Commander's Harness|power_core_status}@{Animated Commander's Harness|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The animated commander’s harness moves to a strategic position and activates its titan shield upgrade before firing on the PCs. The construct prefers to shoot its rifle at range from behind cover, but it attacks with its powerful slam and integrated strident wailing blade if the PCs manage to manoeuvre around its shield.

Morale The animated commander’s harness defends the facility until it’s destroyed.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Executioner Disintegrator Rifle with 1 Super-Capacity Battery (80 Charges), Strident Wailing Blade, Mk 3 Thermal Capacitor, Titan Shield

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ3DJtxCnPmcl8XkQkP_description
attribs.current: The animated commander’s harness can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its allies and creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ3ChUtX2kcPZeyX4-n_description
attribs.current: While it looks like a longsword at a glance, a wailing blade is composed of a series of microtextured plates. When powered, these plates vibrate to generate an array of sonic frequencies at deafening and damaging volumes. Strident wailing blades and warbler wailing blades have pitches that vary, the former sounding like a layered chirping and the latter combining trilling notes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ3CpIyTX9NrVJhpEfF_description
attribs.current: Rather snub nosed compared to other longarms, a disintegrator rifle is heavier than it looks due to the row of round energygenerating compartments atop its frame. These compartments generate enough energy for the weapon to liquefy enemies’ bodies. Well-connected customers can purchase liquidator, decimator, executioner, and eradicator disintegrator rifles.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Nifri-2 starts by attacking with his standard weapons, but as the stress of combat increases, he begins to use his quantum mimicry ability, especially if a PC has a particularly effective tactic.

Morale Nifri-2 surrenders when he is reduced to 25 Hit Points or fewer, at which point it becomes markedly clear he’s a clone; his skin is bubbling, and one of his arms has doubled in length.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Platinum AbadarCorp Travel Suit, Aurora Arc Pistol with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Chares), Ultrathin Dagger

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZicKtCRxPtIFZuVkYx_description
attribs.current: The first time a cloned creature comes within 30 feet and line of sight of their quantum clone, they must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or be paralyzed with dread for 1d4 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZic2-nVDippSopBGZJ_description
attribs.current: As a being of infinite possibilities, a quantum clone can mimic actions taken by others. As a reaction, every 1d4 rounds when a creature the quantum clone can see uses a spell, spell-like ability, or feat, the quantum clone can gain use of that spell or ability until the end of its next turn (even if it doesn’t meet the prerequisites). The spell, spell-like ability, or feat must be one that requires an action to perform (such as Amplified Glitch but not Great Fortitude). The quantum clone uses its CR as its caster level if necessary.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZicNB32kWbTW5GLvZL_description
attribs.current: A quantum clone’s physical body is inherently unstable. In very stressful situations (such as combat or interacting with the being they were cloned from), the quantum clone has difficulty retaining a fixed form. This might manifest through the growth of extra limbs, rippling skin, or the warping of facial features. During this time and for 1 round after, the quantum clone gains the amorphous defensive ability but takes a –10 penalty to Disguise checks.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZibpFKI7Hw47yMfj3i_description
attribs.current: The thinness and lightness of daggers make them easy to carry or conceal. Ultrathin daggers have sharp, double-edged blades. Zero-edge daggers have blades—crafted with quantum technology—that are so fine, their edges blur. The blade of a molecular rift dagger looks translucent, as if it’s made of glass, and its vibrating particles allow the dagger to slice through almost any substance. Most daggers are available with fixed, folding, or retractable blades.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZibuNUV4bV1srq5nMB_description
attribs.current:
Arc pistols fire deadly, stunning blasts of electricity at ranged targets. They have a two-pronged emitter that directs the electrical blast and a bulky chamber that holds the capacitor.

Stun
The quantum clone can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to normal mode) as a move action. While in stun mode, all the weapon’s attacks are nonlethal. See page 252 for more about how nonlethal damage works.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Sivv Defence Drone|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+20@{Sivv Defence Drone|engines_status}@{power_core_status}@{Sivv Defence Drone|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=Piloting   (12 ranks)}}

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZ4MpbIGWKktt62HoQL_description
attribs.current:
Speed 10

Irradiate
A weapon with this special property creates a wave of harmful radiation (see page 403) that penetrates shields and starship hulls. Living creatures on a starship struck by an irradiating weapon are subjected to the level of radiation noted in parentheses for 1d4 rounds of starship combat.

Limited Fire
A weapon with this special property can fire only the listed number of times in a starship combat encounter before it requires a brief period of time (10 minutes outside of starship combat) to recharge and rebuild the weapon’s inherent ammunition. A weapon with this special property is often a tracking weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MZ4NFxDb0JK8xspBh-I_description
attribs.current: Used most often as a last resort, a self-destruct system completely destroys the starship on which it is installed (as if the ship had taken damage equal to twice its Hull Points), often killing everyone on board. A starship in a hex adjacent to a starship that self-destructs takes an amount of damage equal to half the destroyed starship’s maximum Hull Points; this damage can be mitigated by shields. A self-destruct system can be activated only by creatures on the starship (by turning a set of keys, typing in a specific passcode, or other physical means known only to high-ranking members of the crew) and can’t be activated remotely via hacking. The activating creatures set a time delay for the destruction (at least 1 round of starship combat).

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
C3. Labour Loop
Before Combat The exsiccates stealthily manoeuvre to positions on the ceiling just above their victims before attacking.

During Combat The exsiccates take advantage of their unnatural reach to grab PCs and attempt to strip off their flesh.

Morale The exsiccates fight until destroyed.

C5. Upper Ramp
During Combat On the small exterior ramp, the exsiccates get close to the PCs before attacking.

Morale The exsiccates fight until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiXxRKJSF30LLx-k6G_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, an exsiccate can pull strips of flesh from the body of a living creature it has grappled. The target takes 6d4+17 slashing damage and is sickened for 2d4 rounds; a target that succeeds at a DC 19 Fortitude saving throw takes half damage and reduces the sickened condition to 1 round. This is a pain effect

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiXxRKJSF30LLx-k6G_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Sickened for [[2d4]] (2d4) Rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiXxRKJSF30LLx-k6G_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Sickened for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4SSxFDWZvuUXAG1x4_description
attribs.current: When a quantum slime scores a critical hit with its quantum tendril, it teleports the target to a space within 30 feet of its original position that the slime has line of effect to. The target can attempt a DC 23 Will saving throw to negate this effect; if the slime is attempting to teleport the target into a harmful position (such as into a square that is on fire or filled with a cloud of acid), the target receives a +4 circumstance bonus to the saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4SYpNktcnDem15MCf_description
attribs.current: Three times per day as a move action, a quantum slime can form a quantum-entangled copy of itself within 15 feet. The copy is identical to the original slime, including any ongoing bonuses, penalties, or effects with the same remaining duration, and the two slimes share a single pool of Hit Points, uses of spell-like abilities per day, and initiative count. The two slimes count as a single creature for the number of actions they can perform each round, and share the total number of actions between themselves (for instance, one slime can take a move action to move while the other slime takes a standard action to attack); if the slimes take a full action to make a full attack, each slime can attack once with the standard –4 penalty. If a foe attempts to cast a spell that affects both slimes, it must attempt to overcome the spell resistance of each slime, as if the slimes were two different creatures; if the foe fails to overcome the spell resistance of one of the slimes, neither is affected by the spell. If the two slimes are caught in an area effect that doesn’t allow for spell resistance, each one attempts a saving throw (if allowed), and the two slimes use the result of the highest saving throw, though if the spell deals damage, the slimes take damage only once. Any condition successfully imposed on one slime or action taken by one slime to affect itself (such as fighting defensively) affects both copies. When one slime is about to take damage, the quantum slime can “dismiss” that copy as a reaction; this negates the damage and causes the attack (if any) to miss. The remaining quantum slime becomes the “true” version of the creature. The two copies must remain within 200 feet of one another; if they are moved farther apart than that, one random copy of the slime is dismissed as above. Neither copy of the quantum slime can use this ability again while it is active.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4RXsaM1UWIHdW4KQw_description
attribs.current: The quantum slime evokes a vertical column of dangerous material from across the universe that rains down upon creatures in the area. This matter is made up of bits of burning stars and chunks of frozen comets, and it deals 4d6 fire damage and 3d6 cold damage to every creature in the area. This damage occurs only once, when the spell is cast. For the spell’s remaining duration, the fallen starstuff makes the entire area difficult terrain, and thick, swirling clouds of particulate space matter magically block vision. This obscures all sight beyond 5 feet, including darkvision and other vision-based senses (including vision-based blindsight and sense through), but doesn’t prevent blindsense. A creature within 5 feet of its attacker has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker can’t use sight to locate the target). Additionally, the swirling cosmic particles are distracting to spellcasters in the area, who have a 20% chance of losing any spell they attempt to cast in the area. At the end of the duration, the starstuff disappears, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4Rb188kroNXS7gsox_target
attribs.current: One Creature, Object, Spell, or Spellcaster; or a 20 ft.-Radius Burst

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4Rb188kroNXS7gsox_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions like dispel magic, except it can end more than one spell on a target and it can be used to target multiple creatures. The quantum slime chooses to use greater dispel magic in one of three ways: a targeted dispel, an area dispel, or a counter.

Targeted Dispel: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but the quantum slime can dispel three spells, attempting a separate dispel check for each spell. Additionally, greater dispel magic has a chance to dispel any curse that remove affliction can remove, even if dispel magic can’t dispel that effect. The DC of this check is equal to the curse’s DC.

Area Dispel: When greater dispel magic is used in this way, the spell affects everything within a 20-foot-radius burst. Attempt one dispel check and apply that check to each creature or object in the area, as if it were targeted by dispel magic. If the quantum slime doesn’t specify spells and there is more than one possible spell on the target, its targeted dispel attempts to dispel spells at random. Magic items themselves are not affected by an area dispel but additional magical effects on them may be dispelled.

For each ongoing spell effect whose point of origin is within the area of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to dispel the spell. For each ongoing spell whose area overlaps that of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to end the effect, but only within the overlapping area.

If an object or a creature that is the effect of an ongoing spell is in the area, apply the result of the dispel check to end the spell that conjured that object or creature (returning it whence it came) in addition to attempting to dispel one spell targeting the creature or object.

The quantum slime can choose to automatically succeed at its dispel check against any spell you have cast.

Counter: This functions as countering with dispel magic, but the quantum slime receives a +4 bonus to its dispel check to counter the other spellcaster’s spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4Rsb6gEyXSKDTQ9CA_description
attribs.current:
The quantum slime pulls dormant mystical energy from the land and objects around it and uses it to create a swirling eddy that batters its foes and can hinder their movement. The eddy deals 4d6 bludgeoning damage to each creature in the area. Additionally, creatures in the area are knocked prone and are reduced to half speed while the spell is in effect. A creature that succeeds at a Reflex save takes only half damage and is not knocked prone, but it is still reduced to half speed. Flying creatures within the eddy’s area must attempt an Acrobatics check to fly (DC equals the spell’s save DC) each round. Failure means the creature cannot move for that round.

The spell deals damage and knocks creatures prone only once. However, if a creature leaves the spell’s area and then returns, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above again (and can attempt another Reflex saving throw). Similarly, if a creature is not in this spell’s area when it is first cast but later moves into it, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above.

Small, unattended items (no more than light bulk) are also thrown around in the eddy’s area. At the end of the spell’s duration, such items land in a randomly determined space within the spell’s area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4RxjENtPmqJci9H9U_target
attribs.current: One Nonmagical, Nontechnological Object of Nonliving Matter, Up to 15 Bulks; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4RxjENtPmqJci9H9U_description
attribs.current: The quantum slime creates a nonmagical, nontechnological, unattended object of nonliving matter. The volume of the item created can’t exceed 15 cubic fet (or 15 bulk). It must succeed at an appropriate Engineering or Profession check to make a complex item, and it can’t create a consumable item.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4S1rOgSMmciRqvd35_target
attribs.current: The quantum slime and touched objects or touched willing or unconscious creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4S1rOgSMmciRqvd35_description
attribs.current:
The quantum slime instantly transfers itself from its current location to any other spot within range. It always arrive at exactly the spot desired—whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating its direction. It can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed its maximum load. It can also bring up to four additional willing or unconscious Medium or smaller creatures (carrying gear or objects up to their maximum load) or their equivalent. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, and a Huge creature counts as two Large creatures. All creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those creatures must be in contact with it. After using this spell, it can’t take any other actions until its next turn (and each creature traveling with it can’t take any other actions until its next turn).

If it arrives in a place that is already occupied by a solid body, the quantum slime and each creature traveling with it each take [[1d6]] (1d6) damage and are shunted to a random open space on a suitable surface within 100 feet of the intended location. If there is no free space within 100 feet, it and each creature traveling with it take [[2d6]] (2d6) additional damage and are shunted to a free space within 1,000 feet. If there is no free space within 1,000 feet, it and each creature traveling with it take [[4d6]] (4d6) additional damage and the spell simply fails.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4S5WnBAgoesvWAlmE_description
attribs.current: The quantum slime shoots a black ray at a target, making a ranged attack against the target’s EAC. If it hits, the target gains 2 temporary negative levels. Negative levels stack. If the target survives, it recovers from negative levels after a number of hours equal to its caster level (maximum 15 hours). An undead creature struck by the ray gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4SAe-Iole6sIOiRUO_description
attribs.current:
The quantum slime places a terrible curse on the target, stealing either its overall competency or its ability to think and act on its feet. Choose one of the following.
The target takes a –4 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.
The quantum slime can also invent its own curse (see Afflictions on page 414 for a few ideas), but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, miracle, remove affliction, or wish spell.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity. Bestow curse counters remove affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZ4SEnTrpS8Uc-aEZd2_description
attribs.current: The target of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total concealment. Unlike actual total concealment, displacement doesn’t prevent enemies from targeting the creature normally. True seeing reveals the target’s true location and negates the miss chance. If a creature with blindsense can also see the displaced creature, the visual and blindsense information combined are enough for the creature with blindsense to attack the displaced creature without a miss chance, unlike normal for blindsense.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsense (Sound; 60 ft.), Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Sivv Combat Drone|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Sivv Combat Drone|engines_status}@{Sivv Combat Drone|power_core_status}@{Sivv Combat Drone|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: feats
attribs.current: Cleave, Great Cleave, Lunge, Mobility, Sidestep, Spring Attack

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Drone Modes (Echolocators, Enhanced Armour, Excavator, Melee Weapon Arm, Reductive Plating, Skill Subroutine [Athletics], Weapon Proficiencies [2+2], Weapon Mounts [2]), Unliving

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Obscuring Absolute-Zero Hailcannon with 1 Super-Capacity Battery (80 Charges each), Zero-Edge Dagger, Mk 3 Nanite Patch

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat One drone moves into melee combat to take advantage of its Cleave and Sidestep feats. The other fires its hailcannon at any PC who casts a spell or heals an ally.

Morale The sivv combat drones fight until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcWx0SXXnZQFZo0a8y_description
attribs.current: A rogue drone has a number of mods equal to the number it would have as a drone built by a mechanic of a level equal to the rogue drone’s CR.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZcW3IU8hCtRl0zZcwH_description
attribs.current: The thinness and lightness of daggers make them easy to carry or conceal. Ultrathin daggers have sharp, double-edged blades. Zero-edge daggers have blades—crafted with quantum technology—that are so fine, their edges blur. The blade of a molecular rift dagger looks translucent, as if it’s made of glass, and its vibrating particles allow the dagger to slice through almost any substance. Most daggers are available with fixed, folding, or retractable blades.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZcW8BHjk0D0EFjEP1v_description
attribs.current:
Cryo weapons generate blasts of supercooled gas that can damage or incapacitate a target. The gas is kept within a charged cryochamber attached to the weapon. While primitive models simply sprayed these freezing chemicals like a flamethrower, modern models use a containment beam to deliver deadly frozen particles to targets at impressive ranges. Most cryo weapons automatically replenish their reservoirs of reactive chemicals by drawing and processing various gases from the atmosphere, needing only batteries to maintain their ammunition supply.

Obscuring
A weapon with the obscuring fusion emits mist, smoke, or a similar obscuring vapor when wielded. After attacking with the weapon, as a move action the sivv combat drone can cause the weapon to emit enough vapour to conceal it until the start of its next turn. This effect ends immediately if it moves for any reason from where it made its attack. This concealment does not interfere with its attacks or benefit others, even if they move into the space it attacked from, and it can’t use it to hide. Conditions such as strong wind or vacuum that quickly disperse vapours negate this concealment. Only projectile weapons or those that deal cold or fire damage can benefit from this fusion.

Automatic
In addition to making ranged attacks normally, a weapon with this special property can fire in fully automatic mode. No action is required to toggle a weapon between making normal ranged attacks and using automatic mode.

When the sivv combat drone makes a full attack with a weapon in automatic mode, it can attack in a cone with a range of half the weapon’s range increment. This uses all the weapon’s remaining ammunition. Roll one attack against each target in the cone, starting with those closest to it. Attacks made with a weapon in automatic mode can’t score critical hits. Roll damage only once, and apply it to all targets struck. Each attack against an individual creature in the cone uses up the same amount of ammunition or charges as taking two shots, and once it no longer has enough ammunition to attack another target, it stops making attacks.

If more than one creature is equidistant and the sivv combat drone doesn’t have enough cartridges remaining to shoot at all equidistant creatures, determine randomly which one it targets. It can’t avoid shooting at allies in the cone, nor can you shoot any creature more than once, even if it has enough cartridges to fire more shots than it have targets. Attacks in automatic mode take the same penalties as other full attacks.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The bryvaths activate their impossible auras as combat begins. The first bryvath to act in combat uses its light absorption ability, then casts dominate person while the second bryvath attacks with its ray of light. The bryvaths alternate shooting powerful beams of light at their foes and casting offensive spells.

Morale The vicious bryvaths fight to the death to subdue the PCs.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZs8Ej3A2APfyNVi1_description
attribs.current: Once per hour as a swift action, a bryrvath can emit an aura of colours that could not possibly exist; these inconceivable hues ravage the sanity of any creature that stands within them. This aura has a range of 15 feet and lasts for 5 rounds. A creature that begins its turn within or enters the aura must attempt a DC 23 Will saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 1d4 Intelligence and Wisdom damage; a success means the creature takes 2d6 damage and is sickened until the beginning of its next turn. This is a mind-affecting, sense-dependent effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZs8Ej3A2APfyNVi1_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes [[2d6]] (2d6) damage and is sickened until the beginning of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZSn74Z9ArKqjAhbx_description
attribs.current: When a bryrvath is within 10 feet of any light source, it can absorb a portion of the light into its body as a move action. The bryrvath attempts a caster level check (DC = 11 + the item level if the source is an item, or the spell’s caster level if the light comes from a spell); on a success, the light emitted from the target source is lowered by one step for 1 hour and the bryrvath regains 5 Hit Points.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZepPyUA-e0wYfqNr_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a bryrvath can unleash a focused ray of light that can burn a target like the beam of a powerful laser rifle. This ray has a range increment of 120 feet, but it doesn’t function in areas of bright light.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZ1bpintlchYIu49M_description
attribs.current: In an area illuminated by dim light or brighter, a bryrvath can slash its claws through the air in a square adjacent to it, rending the spectrum into tatters. This produces a stationary anomaly of twisting and roiling, half-seen, non-Euclidean shapes that persists for 1d4 rounds. A creature that can see this anomaly at the start of its turn can attempt a DC 23 Will saving throw. If it fails, it is confused for 1 round; if it succeeds, it is instead dazzled for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting, sense-dependent effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZ4uP5NG5FASmYPN4_description
attribs.current:
The bryrvath fires a bright purple ray at its target, making a ranged attack against its target’s EAC, but it can add its key ability score bonus to this attack instead of its Dexterity modifier if it is higher.

If it hits and the bryrvath's target fails its Will saving throw, it establishes a telepathic link with the target’s mind and can control its actions. If it and the target have a common language, it can generally force the target to perform as it desires, within the limits of its abilities. If no common language exists, it can communicate only basic commands, such as “Come here,” “Go there,” “Fight,” and “Stand still.” It knows what the target is experiencing, but it doesn’t receive direct sensory input from it, nor can it communicate with the bryrvath telepathically. Once it has given a dominated creature a command, it continues to attempt to carry out that command to the exclusion of all other activities except those necessary for day-to-day survival (such as sleeping, eating, and so forth). Changing its orders or giving a dominated creature a new command is a move action.

By concentrating fully on the spell (a standard action), the bryrvath can receive full sensory input as interpreted by the mind of the target, though it still can’t communicate with it. It doesn’t actually see through the target’s eyes, but it still gets a good idea of what’s going on.

The target resists this control, and any target forced to take actions against its nature can attempt a new saving throw with a +2 bonus. Obviously self-destructive orders are not carried out. Once control is established, the range at which it can be exercised is unlimited as long as it and the target are on the same plane. It doesn’t need to see the target to control it.

If the Bryrvath doesn’t spend at least 1 round concentrating on the spell each following day, the target can attempt a new saving throw to throw off the domination. It can be prevented from exercising control or using the telepathic link while the target is under the effects of some spells, but such effects don’t automatically dispel the domination.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZ8oFYSp2CDiVUVa4_description
attribs.current:
The bryrvath becomes invisible (as greater invisibility), and at the same time, a figment double of it (as per a 3rd-level casting of holographic image) appears. The double appears within close range (60 ft.) but thereafter moves as the bryrvath directs it (which requires concentration beginning on the first round after the casting). It can make the figment appear superimposed perfectly over its own body so that observers doesn’t notice an image appearing and it turning invisible. The bryrvath and the figment can then move in different directions. The double moves at its speed and can talk and gesture as if it were real, but it can’t attack or cast spells, though it can pretend to do so.

The illusory double lasts as long as the bryrvath concentrates upon it plus 3 additional rounds. After it ceases concentration, the illusory double continues to carry out the same activity until the duration expires. The invisibility lasts for 1 round per level, regardless of concentration.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZDwGvaaF2nEQMTJd_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creature’s turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZIox4jSsVwISH4RZ_description
attribs.current: This spell functions like invisibility, except it doesn’t end if the target attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZNSst2qCxBg59KDV_description
attribs.current:
The bryrvath gains access to the target’s memories and knowledge, and it can pry the information it wants from them involuntarily.

The bryrvath can attempt to learn the answer to one question of its choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 16. If it fails its Bluff check, the bryrvath gains the answer it desires. If it succeeds at its check, the bryrvath gains no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and the bryrvath believes that wrong answer to be the truth. Its questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into its mind. It and the target doesn’t need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to its questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZRMugjnSslnyHZKM_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Fatigued for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZRMugjnSslnyHZKM_description
attribs.current: The bryrvath divines the most vulnerable portion of its opponent’s mind and overloads it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZWV2P09oOVtbs97Q_description
attribs.current:
This spell allows the bryrvath to see magic sources within 120 feet of it. The effect is similar to that of a detect magic spell, but arcane sight does not require concentration and discerns information more quickly.

The bryrvath knows the location and caster level of all magic sources within its sight. If the magic sources are in line of sight, it can attempt a DC 28 Mysticism check (one check per source) to determine the school of magic involved in each source.

If the bryrvath concentrates on a specific creature within 120 feet of it as a standard action, it can determine whether it has any spellcasting or spell-like abilities and the caster level of the most powerful spell or spell-like ability the creature currently has available for use.

The bryrvath can attempt a Mysticism skill check to identify the properties of magic or hybrid items (but not artefacts), as if it was using identify.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZcZZAfekIkJxGBfpZ0_description
attribs.current:
The bryrvath creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables it to hear or see (its choice) almost as if it was there. It doesn’t need line of sight or line of effect to create this sensor in a specific spot within range, but the locale must be either a place that’s familiar to it or an obvious location, such as inside a cave whose entrance it can see.

The sensor doesn’t move, but the bryrvath can rotate it in all directions to view the area as desired. This spell functions only on the plane of existence it is currently occupying.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZcYwNkZ2Qpp4V72OLl_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a bryrvath can unleash a focused ray of light that can burn a target like the beam of a powerful laser rifle. This ray has a range increment of 120 feet, but it doesn’t function in areas of bright light.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The keeper drone deftly climbs the walls or machinery and shoots at intruders with its rifle. When it senses a group of PCs gathered in one area, it uses its falling crush ability to damage as many targets as possible. The keeper relies on its redirect power ability to keep its rifle charged and to unleash electrical damage on the PCs whenever possible.

Morale The keeper obeys its programming to kill all intruders until it’s destroyed.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Sivv Keeper Drone|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Sivv Keeper Drone|engines_status}@{Sivv Keeper Drone|power_core_status}@{Sivv Keeper Drone|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Avalanche-Class Zero Rifle with 1 Ultra-Capacity Battery (100 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZYEbYaQ7l2FeSAPIsC_description
attribs.current: If a keeper robot is at least 20 feet directly above any number of Medium or smaller creatures in a 10-foot square (usually due to its spider climb ability), it can release its grip on the surface as a move action and fall onto those creatures. The keeper robot takes falling damage as normal, but each creature it falls on takes 13d6+29 bludgeoning damage and is pinned. Each crushed target can attempt to escape the pin as normal on its turn, and the pin ends automatically if the keeper robot moves off the target’s square. A target of falling crush can’t take the falling crush damage more than once, unless the keeper robot moves fully off that creature and then falls on it again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZYFDKqFRJydl7oJMg0_description
attribs.current: A keeper robot’s nanites heal it, restoring a number of Hit Points per hour equal to its CR. Once per day as a full action, the robot can regain 12d8 ([[12d8]]) Hit Points.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZYEdhifOPtTqDe99A2_description
attribs.current: A keeper robot can leech power from nearby batteries to recharge its own weapon or unleash the stolen electricity at its foes. A keeper robot can activate this ability once every 1d4 ([[1d4]]) rounds as a full action; when it does, each battery within 30 feet of the robot (excluding the one in its own weapon) loses 2d4 ([[2d4]]) charges. The keeper robot can redirect this power to recharge the battery in its integrated weapon with the same number of charges. Alternatively, the keeper robot can amplify this power, releasing it in a weaponized arc of electricity, dealing 19d6 electricity damage in a 40-foot cone (Reflex DC 23 half).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZYEShGlXrfgBzI1Ryw_description
attribs.current: Zero rifles have long, bulky barrels and tend to be very frontheavy. A heavy tank over the barrel stores the rifle’s coolant supply, contributing most of its bulk.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhgBNnPrKD2Grxb5DE_description
attribs.current: An avigwyr’s attack reveals the true nature of their opponent. When a target is hit by an avigwyr’s attack, any illusions or spells that change the target’s appearance or shape (such as polymorph) are subject to dispel magic with a caster level equal to the avigwyr’s CR. If the target is disguised, all creatures viewing the target can attempt a Perception check with a +10 circumstance bonus to pierce the disguise.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhgV7O-b8WoVgqCKKa_description
attribs.current: An avigwyr can turn themself into code to merge with a computer. This functions as transfer consciousness (Starfinder Character Operations Manual 142), but the avigwyr can target only computers with this effect. An avigwyr’s body and gear disappear while they’re merged, and they can transfer to any other computer they’re connected to via a control module, infosphere, or network, provided that computer is a valid target for transfer consciousness. An avigwyr can exit a computer they’re merged with at any time, appearing in an adjacent space.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhgd5OidXJ2zVwacZq_description
attribs.current: An avigwyr can hurl deadly bolts of electricity as a ranged attack with a range increment of 50 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZhcZAfLux4wROp0J7P_description
attribs.current:
The double-edged blade of an ultrathin longsword is made of dense metal that holds its edge and adds heft to a swing. The blade appears exceptionally thin and light, belying the damage it can deal.

Limning
Successful attacks with a weapon with the limning fusion surround the target with a glowing aura. For 1 round after the avigwyr successfully attacks a single creature with its weapon, it is surrounded by a pale glow that reveals its location. While so illuminated, the creature takes a –20 penalty to Stealth checks and does not benefit from concealment provided by darkness, invisibility, smoke, and similar effects. However, displacement and other effects that shift location entirely are not negated. The light is too dim to harm creatures vulnerable to light and does not serve to illuminate anything but the creature affected by limning. Limning weapons create glows in a variety of hues, and some even bestow a variety of colors. The limning fusion has no effect on attacks that affect multiple foes.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhd4NyZvIaThAgoMcd_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhd4NyZvIaThAgoMcd_description
attribs.current:
This spell frees victims from curses, enchantments, and transmutations. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, the avigwyr attempts a caster level check (1d20 + 13) against a DC equal to 11 + the caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect. For a cursed magic item, the DC of the caster level check is equal to the DC of the curse.

If the spell is one that can’t be dispelled by dispel magic, break enchantment works only if that spell is 5th level or lower. If the effect comes from a permanent magic item, break enchantment doesn’t remove the curse from the item but it does free the victim from the item’s effects.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdDAQh94VxwZYKZ86_description
attribs.current:
The avigwyr weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form they can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures.

When the avigwyr casts holographic image as a 5th-level spell, they produce a hologram as per the 4th-level version of the spell, except the size of the hologram can’t extend beyond a 150-foot cube.

The avigwyr can choose to make the hologram permanent at the time of casting. By concentrating, they can move the image within the limits of the range, but it is static while they are not concentrating.

Alternatively, the avigwyr can have the hologram activate when a specific condition (which they set at the time of casting) occurs. The event that triggers the hologram can be as general or as specific and detailed as desired, but it must be based on an audible, olfactory, tactile, or visual trigger. The trigger can’t be based on some quality not normally obvious to the senses, such as alignment. The spell lasts until it is triggered, and then the hologram lasts for 13 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdJ1Fk4ypZsLhT1HD_description
attribs.current:
The avigwyr creates an invisible magical sensor that sends them visual information. The sensor appears at any point within line of sight, but it can then travel beyond their line of sight without hindrance. An arcane eye travels at 30 feet per round (300 feet per minute) if viewing an area ahead as a humanoid would (primarily looking at the floor) or 10 feet per round (100 feet per minute) if examining the ceiling and walls as well as the floor ahead. The arcane eye sees exactly as they would see if they were there.

The arcane eye can travel in any direction as long as the spell lasts. Solid barriers block its passage, but it can pass through a hole or space as small as 1 inch in diameter. The arcane eye can’t enter another plane of existence, even through Drift travel or a magical gate or similar magical portal.

The avigwyr must concentrate to use an arcane eye. If they do not concentrate, the sensor is inert until they concentrate again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdMwH9mPXsCXXVPx4_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdMwH9mPXsCXXVPx4_description
attribs.current: Each round, the avigwyr concentrates on one target within range. They know if the target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in their aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesn’t necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, the they can concentrate on a different target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdMwH9mPXsCXXVPx4_effect
attribs.current: Any attempt at lying is found out.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhdZOEyUDyJ3oKKvYk_description
attribs.current:
The avigwyr gains access to the target’s memories and knowledge, and they can pry the information they want from them involuntarily.

The avigwyr can attempt to learn the answer to one question of their choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 39. If it fails its Bluff check, they gain the answer they desire. If it succeeds at its check, they gain no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and you believe that wrong answer to be the truth. Their questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into their mind. They and the target don’t need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to their questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhfb-elfFeTiisXZU-_description
attribs.current:
The avigwyr creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables them to hear or see (their choice) almost as if they were there. They don’t need line of sight or line of effect to create this sensor in a specific spot within range, but the locale must be either a place that’s familiar to them or an obvious location, such as inside a cave whose entrance they can see.

The sensor doesn’t move, but the avigwyr can rotate it in all directions to view the area as desired. This spell functions only on the plane of existence they are currently occupying.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhfoD-4Pa-7dr3MjoU_target
attribs.current: One Living or Deceased Sentient Creature; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhfoD-4Pa-7dr3MjoU_description
attribs.current:
The avigwyr reaches into the target’s mind, extract a specific memory, and project that memory into a small hologram that plays in front of them and is visible to all creatures who can see it. The hologram memory can be no longer than 1 minute; if the extracted memory is longer than this, the hologram simply ends. The hologram includes audio as well as visual components, but it does not contain haptic, olfactory, or other components. The hologram typically plays a memory that takes place in a single scene, though it can cut to multiple scenes, if they are accurate to the memory and its length allows. The hologram plays the memory exactly as the target experienced it and from the target’s perspective, so it often lacks context. The target creature must remain quiet and still while the hologram plays or the spell and hologram end.

This spell can target any living, unconscious, or deceased sentient creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of –4 or higher). If the target is deceased, it cannot have been dead for longer than 1 week, or this spell fails; once a corpse has been subjected to hologram memory by any caster, any subsequent attempts to cast hologram memory on that corpse fail.

If the target is unwilling to share this memory (or if it would be unable to share the memory, in the case of an unconscious or deceased target), it can attempt a Will saving throw with a +4 bonus to negate this spell and its effects.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZhckNyZYwbQMPZVSJX_description
attribs.current: An avigwyr can hurl deadly bolts of electricity as a ranged attack with a range increment of 50 feet.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Change Shape (Any SMall, Medium, or Large Creature), Terms and Conditions

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Bespoke Echelon Fashion, Executioner Disintegrator Pistol with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhu0cWm8SDmu-qxtD9_description
attribs.current: When a creature unwittingly allies with an adikodaemon, typically by accepting a boon or favour from the daemon in disguise, they must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or succumb to the curse of planned obsolescence (see below).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZhnhZ0GTJg-fa6j7Ju_description
attribs.current: This hefty pistol has two small internal tanks that generate the energy needed to deliquesce the wielder’s targets. Disintegrator pistols come in liquidator, decimator, executioner, and eradicator models.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhnprIMaXMe-Ds0kuM_description
attribs.current: The adikodaemon can attempt to summon creatures of the same creature type as itself as a full action. The summoned ally cannot summon its own allies, is worth 0 experience points, and returns to the place from which it came after 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZho3gNId9IeWz864eQ_target
attribs.current: One Creature or Object, or up to a 10-ft. cube of nonliving matter

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZho3gNId9IeWz864eQ_description
attribs.current:
Immense power shoots from the adikodaemon finger, with the potential to disintegrate a target where it stands.

When the adikodaemon casts this spell, a thin, green ray springs from their pointing finger. They must make a ranged attack against their target’s EAC, but they can add their key ability score bonus to this attack instead of their Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If they hit, the target takes 14d20 damage. Any creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this spell is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creature’s equipment is unaffected. Only one target is affected per casting of this spell.

When used against an object, the ray simply disintegrates as much as a 10-foot cube of nonliving matter. Thus, the spell disintegrates only part of any very large object or structure targeted. The ray affects even objects constructed entirely of force, but it does not affect other magical effects that are not an object, creature, or force effect.

A creature or object that succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw is partially affected, taking only 4d20 damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 Hit Points, the target is entirely disintegrated.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZho3gNId9IeWz864eQ_effect
attribs.current: Target takes full damage and reduced to dust if its hit point reduces to 0.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZho3gNId9IeWz864eQ_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes [[4d20]] (4d20) damage and reduced to dust if its hit point reduces to 0.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZho9osg4Gjf0O8m96H_description
attribs.current:
The adikodaemon weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form they can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures.

When the adikodaemon casts holographic image as a 5th-level spell, they produce a hologram as per the 4th-level version of the spell, except the size of the hologram can’t extend beyond a 150-foot cube.

The adikodaemon can choose to make the hologram permanent at the time of casting. By concentrating, they can move the image within the limits of the range, but it is static while they are not concentrating.

Alternatively, the adikodaemon can have the hologram activate when a specific condition (which they set at the time of casting) occurs. The event that triggers the hologram can be as general or as specific and detailed as desired, but it must be based on an audible, olfactory, tactile, or visual trigger. The trigger can’t be based on some quality not normally obvious to the senses, such as alignment. The spell lasts until it is triggered, and then the hologram lasts for 13 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoHxN28Ek7n-LxcWb_description
attribs.current: The adikodaemon makes terrain look, sound, and smell like some other sort of terrain. Equipment, structures, and vehicles within the area can be hidden or changed in appearance. The illusion includes audible, olfactory, tactile, and visual elements and is effective against cameras, living creatures, robots, and scrying spells. This spell can’t disguise or add creatures nor can it make them invisible (though creatures within the area might hide themselves within the illusion just as they can hide themselves within a real location).

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoMFeLffteFvVDph8_target
attribs.current: One Creature with CR 17 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoMFeLffteFvVDph8_description
attribs.current:
The adikodaemon's overwhelming presence bores into the target’s mind, cowing its will. This turns it into an automaton-like guardian that protects them at all costs. As soon as it is able, the target mindlessly moves along the most direct route toward them and stops when it is within 10 feet of them (provoking attacks of opportunity for movement as normal). If they are being attacked in melee by a creature within 10 feet, the target instead takes the quickest route to intercept that creature from a square within 10 feet of them and attack it on their behalf.

While this spell is in effect, the target attacks any creature that attacks the adikodaemon in melee, though it can’t move more than 10 feet from them to do so. If multiple creatures are attacking them in melee, they can choose which creature the target attacks on their behalf as part of combat banter. If they are the target of ranged attacks and their guardian is not attacking a melee assailant on their behalf, it moves to provide cover against the ranged attacks. Due to the strong momentary connection between them and their unwilling guardian, if they are the single target of a hostile creature’s spell or effect, the creature must succeed at a caster level check (DC = 26) or the spell or effect instead targets their guardian. This spell has no effect on area of effect or multi-target spells or other effects that include them as a target.

When this spell ends, the target regains control of its faculties entirely and it knows and remembers that the adikodaemon used magic to control it. Once a creature has been the target of unwilling guardian, it can’t be targeted with this spell again for 24 hours if cast by the same spellcaster.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoSlt-A0dPrIqJPbf_target
attribs.current: One Non-Hostile Construct of the Technological Subtype; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoSlt-A0dPrIqJPbf_description
attribs.current:
Waves of inciting programming ebb from the adikodaemon's touch, reprogramming a construct to have murderous intentions toward their enemies. This spell must target a construct that is not already programmed or tasked with harming them. The target construct must have a CR lower than 18. If the target construct is under the control of another creature, the controlling creature can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = the spell’s DC) to negate this spell’s effect.

While this spell is in effect, the construct is under the adikodaemon's control. On their turn starting when they cast this spell, they must direct it to attack a target; the construct then pursues and attacks this target as best it can. They can change which target the construct attacks as part of their concentration to continue this spell’s duration (a standard action). When they stop concentrating or when the spell’s duration otherwise ends, the construct immediately stops following their commands to attack.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MZhoX4Q8QZ1oFXYZ4OK_description
attribs.current: This spell functions like invisibility, except it doesn’t end if the target attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZhoZi2kBVPqOPiKLjN_description
attribs.current:
The adikodaemon sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects that are invisible or displaced, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of changed or transmuted things. Further, the target can focus its vision to see into the Ethereal Plane (but not into extradimensional spaces).

True seeing, however, does not penetrate solid objects. It in no way confers X-ray vision or its equivalent. It does not negate concealment, including that caused by fog and the like. True seeing does not help the viewer see through mundane disguises, spot creatures who are simply hiding, or notice secret doors hidden by mundane means.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat If the PCs seem set on killing him, Izuvnael takes flight and casts holographic terrain, altering the Worldseed to take on the visual characteristics of Abaddon. Any PCs who fail the Will save against this spell perceive the area as a wasteland cloaked in black mists and dotted with pillars of bones. Izuvnael takes cover behind an illusory bone pillar and first casts unwilling guardian on one PC and disintegrate on another. Izuvnael then attacks solely with his disintegrator pistol.

Morale Adikodaemons prefer manipulation to direct conflict and know when to abandon a situation that puts their continued existence at risk. When reduced to 100 Hit Points or fewer, Izuvnael casts greater invisibility and flees.

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Abyssal, Common, Infernal (Can't Speak Any Language)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiVF1Iv85vqgyW0frd_description
attribs.current: When a death cruiser deals damage to a creature with its incorporeal slam attack, it can spend 1 RP to immediately attempt to collect the creature’s soul, affecting that creature as snuff life (Fortitude DC 20 partial). Creatures suffering from a fear effect take a –4 penalty to this save. The soul of a creature slain by this ability is trapped inside the death cruiser. A trapped soul can be restored to life only by miracle, warp reality (Character Operations Manual 143), or wish. A creature that succeeds at its save is immune to that death cruiser’s collect soul ability for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiVF1Iv85vqgyW0frd_effect
attribs.current:
A creature of CR 5 or lower is slain by this spell.

A creature of CR 6–10 takes [[10d20]] (10d20) damage and is stunned for 3 rounds.

A creature of CR 11–14 takes [[8d20]] 8d20 damage and is staggered for 3 rounds.

A creature of CR 15 or higher takes [[6d20]] (6d20) damage. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiVF1Iv85vqgyW0frd_save_effect
attribs.current:
A creature of CR 5 or lower is reduced to 1 Hit Point.

A creature of CR 6–10 takes [[10d20]] 10d20 damage.

A creature of CR 11–14 takes half of [[8d20]] (8d20) damage.

A creature of CR 15 or higher takes half of [[6d20]] (6d20) damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiVHgIND5mVYpTfGsL_description
attribs.current: A death cruiser has many characteristics of a vehicle, including full speed 650 feet and overland speed 75 mph (ground and fly). It obeys the tactical vehicle and vehicle chase rules, using its own Piloting skill to pilot itself and treating its CR as its vehicle level. A death cruiser using the race manoeuvre when starting from a full stop doesn’t increase the DC of Piloting checks by 5. At the beginning of any of its turns, a death cruiser can choose to suppress its incorporeal ability until the beginning of its next turn; when it does, it gains a collision attack that deals 15d10 bludgeoning damage (Reflex DC 18 half) and hardness 20.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiVJxP0S6CSrqXTSWO_description
attribs.current: When the death cruiser has trapped a soul with collect soul, all of the death cruiser’s movement speeds double (including the speeds listed in the death racer ability). This does not affect its collision attack damage, and the doubling occurs before applying any other effects that increase its speed.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Nullsoul Host|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Nullsoul Host|engines_status}@{Nullsoul Host|power_core_status}@{Nullsoul Host|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZt1n3M7cw1UxhKAa_description
attribs.current: A nullsoul host traps the soul of its victim within itself, but healing magic disrupts this effect and damages the host. Any effect that heals the Hit Points of living creatures instead deals damage to a nullsoul host; the nullsoul host does not get a saving throw against this damage, even if the effect would normally grant one.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZ35WCQ0Io-lEo7Pg_description
attribs.current: A nullsoul host can quickly reconfigure its limbs and digits into whatever tools it requires. As a move action, a nullsoul host can turn one of its limbs into a tool kit of any type or turn the tool kit back into a limb. The nullsoul host can manipulate these tools without requiring an additional hand. These tool kits cannot be removed from the nullsoul host even after it’s destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZCh0VpFY3pQMOYTf_description
attribs.current: A nullsoul host can fling a shard of nanites containing raw nullsoul data. This attack has a range increment of 40 feet and exposes androids to nullsoul.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MZiZUcU4GcxD4j6ApAb_description
attribs.current: A nullsoul host can fling a shard of nanites containing raw nullsoul data. This attack has a range increment of 40 feet and exposes androids to nullsoul.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZaxOPKdHhNZ1PinV_description
attribs.current: On each round, the target construct or weapon regains 2d8 Hit Points. This does not stack with any fast healing the construct or weapon already has. The nullsoul host can’t target a construct or weapon that has been brought to 0 Hit Points or destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZe7LT9kgtpD8xagr_duration
attribs.current: 13 Hours or Until Expended; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZe7LT9kgtpD8xagr_description
attribs.current:
