The nullsoul host gains the ability to step into a piece of electronic equipment currently connected to a communication or information network (such as a comm unit or a computer connected to an infosphere), converting itself into digital information and traveling along the network. Once uploaded onto a network, it teleports out from any device within 3,000 feet of the device that it entered; if no such device is in range, it emerges from the same device it entered. The nullsoul host is instantly aware of all unsecured devices connected to the same network as the one it entered, and it can attempt a Computers check (DC = 15 + 1-1/2 × the item’s level) to detect other devices (this does not require an action); a single check renders it aware of all devices whose DC to detect it exceededs. If the item is a computer, its Computers check result must also exceed the DC required to successfully hack it. This movement acts as the teleport spell, except there is no chance of missing its destination.

When attempting to enter or exit a computer with one or more countermeasures, the nullsoul host automatically triggers any countermeasures that are not successfully disabled. When it emerges from a computer, it can attempt one Computers check, with the result compared to the DC of each countermeasure in place on that computer (this does not require an action); the nullsoul host suffers the effects of all countermeasures with a DC higher than the result of its check. Some countermeasures triggered in this manner are exceptionally dangerous, as noted below.

Feedback: The digital virus uploaded into the nullsoul host's data causes it to become exposed to the mindfire disease, but the disease has a save DC of 15 + half the item level of the destination device.

Firewall: The nullsoul host arrives at the destination prone, and it remains flat-footed and off-target for 1 minute.

Wipe: The nullsoul host's recent memories are scrambled, with minor elements removed, causing it to be confused for a number of rounds equal to half the item level of the destination device (minimum 1 round).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZiZi1LRsIftWJgIvto_description
attribs.current:
The warded creature or object becomes difficult to detect by divination spells such as clairaudience/clairvoyance and spells with the word “detect” in their names. Nondetection also prevents location by magic items such as crystal balls and technological items such as cameras and surveillance systems. Casting this spell places significant stress on the nullsoul host, and requires it to spend 1 Resolve Point.

If a magic divination is attempted against the warded creature or item, the caster of the divination must succeed at a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against a DC equal to 24. If surveillance is attempted with remote cameras or sensors, the viewer must succeed at a Perception check against a DC equal to 24 to see the target. If the nullsoul host casts nondetection on itself or on an item currently in its possession, the DC for each these checks is equal to 28. If cast on a creature, nondetection wards the creature’s gear as well as the creature itself.

Nondetection protects the target only from discovery by items and remote sensors, not by creatures. A camera mounted to a wall and monitored from a security booth is subject to nondetection, but a camera in a creature (including constructs) is not.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MZieXeNchY5NhoqbZjD_description
attribs.current: Every 1d4 rounds as a standard action, an umbracygot can spit a 60-foot line of acid that deals 10d6 acid damage. The acid continues to burn each affected creature, dealing an additional 4d6 acid damage on the following round. A target that succeeds at a DC 19 Reflex save takes half the initial damage and avoids the ongoing damage.

attribs.current: Full Damage and [[4d6]] (4d6) Additional Damage Next Round.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MZYKDqP3qv4GJO9xr4y_description
attribs.current: Unconverted expansion bays count as cargo holds. A cargo hold can contain approximately 25 tons of goods, with no item being larger than Large. A starship with multiple cargo holds can hold larger objects; usually 4 contiguous cargo holds are required to hold Huge objects and 8 for Gargantuan objects. These size restrictions can be overridden at the GM’s discretion.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MZYKJT9gEZCaFEU1mbC_description
attribs.current: Starships that function as passenger vessels require spaces apart from their crew quarters for their guests to sleep. A single expansion bay can be converted into common quarters (usually simple bunks or hammocks) for six passengers, good quarters (usually a comfortable bed, a desk with a chair, and a small set of drawers) for four passengers, or luxurious quarters (usually a large bed, a wardrobe, a couch, a desk with a nice chair, and a private washroom) for two passengers.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MZYKOZw2Uh7hidh1rM2_description
attribs.current: A medical bay functions as a medical lab (see page 220).

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MZYKQmdNEWJ6PCVU1bZ_description
attribs.current: A recreation suite includes entertainments that help the crew (or passengers) relax and blow off steam. These diversions can be wide-ranging, with some consuming more PCU than others (see the table on page 300). Example recreation suites include a gym, sparring arena, or other exercise area; a trivid den or other comfortable space in which to consume passive entertainment; or a holographic amusement chamber (or HAC), vidgame arcade, or other high-tech interactive entertainment centre.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-NAebCg-kLFKDGfmDwVi_description
attribs.current:
Arc pistols fire deadly, stunning blasts of electricity at Ranged Targets. They have a two-pronged emitter that directs the electrical blast and a bulky chamber that holds the capacitor.

Stun
You can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to Normal mode) as a Move Action. While in stun mode, all the weapon's Attacks are Nonlethal.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current: Morale Nifri generally shoots at Nifri-2 but will lash out against a PC who gets in his way. He stands down after being reduced to 100 Hit Points or fewer or after he takes his first critical hit.
